description.narrative:
Plan International Sverige har ansökt om finansiering av egeninsats om 762 361 SEK för ECHO-projektet "Strengthening of Humanitarian Response Capacity and Disaster Preparedness in Communities Vulnerable to the Active Fuego Volcano (pyroclastic flows, lahars) and Floods in the Department of Escuintla and Sacatepequez, Guatemala" under åren 2019-2020.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka den humanitära responsen, katastrofberedskapen och skyddskapaciteten på kommunal-, samhälls- och utbildningsnivå i områden som påverkas av vulkanen Fuego i Escuintla och Sacatepequez, Guatemala.
Den aktuella insatsen har EU-kommissionens referensnummer: ECHO/-AM//BUD/2019/91000. Insatsen har en total budget på 941 176 EUR, vilket motsvarar cirka 10 708 946 SEK. Sökt stöd från Sida är 762 361 SEK, vilket motsvarar cirka 7 procent av den totala budgeten.

Plan International Sweden has applied to Sida for funding of 762 361 SEK to carry out the ECHO-project "Strengthening of Humanitarian Response Capacity and Disaster Preparedness in Communities Vulnerable to the Active Fuego Volcano (pyroclastic flows, lahars) and Floods in the Department of Escuintla and Sacatepequez, Guatemala" during the period 2019-2020.
The purpose of the action is to strengthen the humanitarian response, disaster risk reduction and protection capacities at municipal, community and school levels in the area affected by the Fuego Vulcano in the Departments of Escuintla and Sacatepequez, Guatemala.
The contribution has the European Commission reference number: ECHO/-AM//BUD/2019/91000. The contribution's total budget is 941 176 EUR, corresponding to approximately 10 708 946 SEK. The requested support from Sida is 762 361 SEK, which corresponds to approximately 7 per cent of the total budget.

Principial objective:
Contribute to reduce the impact of disasters caused by volcanic activity for the most vulnerable populations of Guatemala.
Specific objective:
Humanitarian response, disaster risk reduction and protection capacities are strengthened at municipal, community and school levels in the area affected by the Fuego volcano in the Departments of Escuintla and Sacatepequez in Guatemala.
Result 1:
Strengthen the disaster preparedness and response capacity of the CONRED System (National Coordinator For Disaster Reduction) through the organization of COMRED (Community Coordinator For Disaster Reduction), COLRED (Local Coordinator For Disaster Reduction) and GRRD School Committees. Development of response plans, basic equipment, simulation exercises, drills, accreditation.
Result 2:
Strengthen the municipal and community warning transmission systems by INSIVUMEH (National Institute Of Seismology, Volcanology, Meteorology And Hydrology) and SE-CONRED for Fuego volcano activity in the face of pyroclastic flows and lahars. Create an evacuation system for the affected population; prepare transmission protocols; monitor, evacuate, rehabilitate and adapt shelters.
Result 3:
Strengthen referral networks; creation of protection protocols for identification and referral of cases of violence against women and girls in emergencies; awareness-raising campaigns; training for State personnel and the general population.
Result 4:
Response to emergencies in the action's coverage area to respond to the most urgent needs of the affected population; provision of hygiene kits; food security activities and livelihood actions.

description.narrative:
Exempel på uppnådda resultat:
"Institutions, communities, families and individuals are more resilient, and better prepared to respond, to disasters and emergencies. The intervention has facilitated information from the community to be shared and inform the Disaster Risk Reduction plans. According to the final KAP 85% of the targeted members of local and municipal organizations were familiar with the transmission of alerts and evacuation protocols. 79% of participants at the CERED, COLRED and institutional level in the targeted communities now know and apply protection mechanisms for women and children, response plans and evacuation plans."
"Implementation of an awareness and information campaign: reaching 1 million people. A radio campaign was launched, with an anticipated effective reach of 70% (700,000 people). It was complemented by an information campaign on social networks, the delivery of printed information and messages sent to mobile phones."
"During the impact of storms Amanda and Cristobal, 27 COLREDs were activated to monitor and warn the population; 12 communities evacuated families in line with maps and response plans identifying the houses most at risk; and shelters were also set up at the local and municipal levels using the response plans and in coordination with COMREDs."
"In spite of the restrictions due to the impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic, the implementing teams worked hard to find alternative approaches to support the different targeted groups, working remotely and promoting digital platforms to undertake trainings. A consistent support to the target population on the use of digital platforms allowed for a successful implementation."
"Women and girls have been in majority within the local and municipal groups organised and participated on an equal footing with men ensuring that their perspective is included in the response plans."
"By the end of the project, 85% of the members of COLRED, COMRED and the Referral Networks were aware of mechanisms for the protection of women and girls during an emergency."
Nedan följer exempel på resultat kopplade till Strategin för stöd genom svenska organisationer i det civila samhället 2016-2022.
Link to strategy goal 1. Strengthened capacity within civil society in developing countries to contribute to poverty reduction in developing countries:
"By the end of the project, 90% of the trained COLREDs and COMREDs demonstrate that they have developed their capacities to respond to an emergency or disaster, thus reducing the impact and damage that the community may face."
"As part of the action 27 DRR School Committees (CEREDs), 10 COLREDs, 2 COMREDs and 10 Community Protection Networks were organised and received training. At the end of the project the evaluation showed that 79% of participants at the CERED, COLRED and institutional level in the targeted communities (compared to an average of 34.8% at baseline) know and apply response plans, evacuation plans and protection mechanisms for women and children"
"Training processes for women leaders and technical staff who make up the referral networks: 60 women leaders, who recognise the different manifestations and forms of violence that exist, and can recognise and refer cases of violence against women and children. These women were given advice and, where necessary, supported in the initial phase of their complaint. In the referral networks 306 people took part in capacity building processes (238 women and 38 men). 100% of the COLREDs and COMREDs integrate protection actions into their response plans and evacuation protocols. The risk maps identify vulnerable populations."
"The project included several aspects of learning and capacity building to create awareness, engagement and capacity among community members - including vulnerable groups of the population such as infants and young children, elderly, disabled to have knowledge about and claim their rights to protection against violence and right to live in a safe and secure environment. By linking these community members to both formal and informal civil society actors also contributed to a stronger and more legitimate civil society that represented the people they work for, and supported the same community members to organise and claim their rights."
"The participating 265 teachers developed school response plans which were validated through simulation exercises. The school response plans covered 6,467 students. Furthermore, 105 members participating in the 10 COLREDs undertook a hazard, vulnerability and capacities analysis highlighting vulnerabilities and hazards in their communities."
Link to strategy goal 2. Promoting an enabling environment for civil society organisations in developing countries:
"The project's main contribution to the CSO strategy goal number 2 was the creation of spaces for collaboration and dialogue between civil society actors and other development actors within the field of DRR as well as with the vulnerable populations whom they represent. To strengthen the mechanisms for interaction and collaboration by ensuring that they function effectively and that the actors involved have the necessary technical capacity and skills, therefore directly contributes to a more enabling environment for them to operate."
"The COMRED of Escuintla and San Juan Alotenango was reorganized and trained including integrating 57 institutional representatives. The COMREDs have in a coordinated manner developed the Municipal Response Plan. The simulation exercise with the COMRED was unfortunately not possible due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The project technical team exhausted the options to finalize this process, but it was not possible"
